parameters: \willThere you four are! The adventurers that slayed
Laeryidyean... I am honored to meet you all.
\willI'm assuming you're here for the magic
forge? Follow me, I'll show you around.
metal reserves, a cooling vat... and of
equipment. It has been guarded by my family
for hundreds and hundreds of years.
\p3Interesting story... so, can we get forging?
\willWell... I was actually going to get to that next.
I foolishly brought several tools critical to forge
maintainence with me to the mine. I was ambushed by
monsters and unfortunately dropped everything I needed.
\willI'll do as much as I can to set up the
forge for now. If you four can go to the
mine and retrieve my items, you'll be able
to start crafting as soon as you return!
So We Back In The Mine
\willWhile you're there, you may as well mine some ore.
\willThe mine is accessed by following a path
leading to the north end of town. Leave the
building and go up, I'm sure you'll find it.
Do you need anything from me?
How do I use equipment in crafting? <<!s[49]>>
So, more about the Blazing Sands... <<!s[49] || s[50]>>
\willAh, alright. I'll see what I've got today.
rushing back here without the items
isn't going to do anything for you.
So We Back In The Mine
\willAs I promised, the forge is ready.
\willJust note that if you've used any upgraders on
a piece of equipment, it needs to be reset using
a \ii[54] before you can craft with it.
\willThat's really all there is to it!
\willSo... you four are going to Telluria Castle
next? I'm assuming that you don't know the
\willBut if you don't have to leave right
away, I really need your help. And
\willThe Blazing Sands have a dark history...
if you're interested in helping me out
just say the word. Good luck out there.
How do I use equipment in crafting? <<!s[49]>>
\willIf you've used upgraders on any piece of
equipment, you'll need to reset its properties
before using it as a crafting ingredient.
\willAll you have to use is a \ii[54].
Don't worry, I sell those here.
as using any sort of upgrade
scroll or item on your gear.
So, more about the Blazing Sands... <<!s[49] || s[50]>>
\willYou want to learn more about the
ancient history of the Blazing Sands?
a region home to prosperity and
magic. However, it's also home to
\willI'm sure you four already know the
story of the Great Collapse. Have you
ever heard about the ruined fortress?
on the east end of the desert.
\willNear the end of the Great Collapse, the
fortress was one of the last stands of the
\willWith nearly all of the Overworld destroyed,
there were very few places where you could
have the illusion of safety. This fort... it
provided a false sense of security and hope.
\willIt was filled to the brim with soldiers,
all of them making their best effort to live
another day. But no matter how many arrows were
shot or how many fireballs were summoned...
\will...the monsters kept on coming for months on end.
looked grim. A beacon of hope finally appeared
when someone stumbled upon an ancient scroll
older than everything else in the library.
and as the final words were spoken, the
scroll disintegrated, and a blast of light
\willThe monsters... every last one had disappeared.
For the first time in what seemed like forever, the
horizon was clear. Allegedly, the sands glowed a
magnificent silver for the duration of that night.
\willMorale had been restored. With a breath
of fresh air and a restocked food supply,
things were looking good for everyone.
in and slaughtered every last person
in that fort. No one was spared. The
fort was decimated and left to rot.
advantage of the magic sand, using its power to
prevent the souls of those poor soldiers from
reaching the light at the end of the tunnel.
\willYou need to defeat the fiend that has doomed
these souls to an eternity of unrest!
\willI doubt you'll even be able to get into
the fort due to all the rubble... but I
might know a way in. Key word is "might".
\willThe same legend talks about an artifact
created using the magical sands. The
turn back time in the fortress.
\willIt seems impossible for something like this
to exist, but we have to try. It should be
at the peak of the Great Pyramid, which is
out in the middle of the Blazing Sands.
\willReturn to me once you get your hands on the
\ii[99]. We'll make a plan from there.
\willI can see you trying to hold
\willMind if I take a quick look?
\willI've told you the legend already. You know
what you have to do. Go save those souls!
the other side of the counter?
or some gods... but anything works.
\willWell, I'm no scholar in that area
of history... but my family has kept
the history of the Blazing Sands safe
\willDue to my profession, I also know
a few other special things about the
\willOne of these is the age of the Overworld.
Analysis of sediments and other products of age
have revealed the Overworld to be very, very, VERY
old. Hundreds of thousands, at the very least.
\willWhen I first learned of this, that got
me thinking... isn't it odd that with all
that preparation, we still managed to lose
the war a thousand years ago?
was unmatched, but you'd think that
with all that time to develop, we
wouldn't have been crushed THIS bad.
clearly built by humans, but when, and by
who? We've lost all this history... but how?
wasn't the first one, and maybe it won't
humanity, but has failed time and time again.
\p3No, no, I understand. I have my own
crazy theories too. This one, though...
you might really be onto something?
\willReally? Well, I'm glad that my random
thoughts were of some use to you.
\willBut assuming that you four will be
the ones preventing the Great Collapse
\will\c[18]Apocalypse\c[0] is said to be a swordsman
like you. As the most likely candidate to
be the chosen knight, you'll probably
end up in close-quarters combat with \c[18]him\c[0].
\willI know I've suggested this to you before,
but I'll say it once more: I think it's not
a bad idea to at least try to seek out the
\willThe First Knight... his sword is said
to be lost to time, but if youv were
somehow able to find it, it would no
doubt be an asset to your journey.
\willI have no clue where it might be,
it might make the difference between
\p3Well... sounds good. Thanks for the theory and advice, Will.
\willNo problem. Good luck with that whole situation.
\p3With all that running around out of
the way, I say it's about time we go
Craft something at Will's magic forge?
